timeline.bodyText: Nit: I wouldn't wrap here, as it looks funny / different compared to the above. Keeping the wrapping the same would make it easy to see that this is simply adding another argument.
timeline.author: electrum

timeline.bodyText: I dislike this class. We generally avoid subclassing as a means to share code (part of the "prefer delegation" from Effective Java), and here we aren't saving anything, since it's trivial to implement KafkaConsumerFactory directly. The primary purpose seems to be to prevent subclasses from creating KafkaConsumer directly, but I don't see a reason for that.
timeline.author: electrum

replies.bodyText: No because entire DistributedQueryRunner.Builder.build() will not produce correct log messages.

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if it wouldn't be better to model kafka consumer as optional binding, see how I implemented Glue column stats extension, GlueMetastoreModule.
timeline.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText: actually it is not optional. To make kafka work one has to provide kafka consumer. By it could be a different class depending on how kafka is extended.
replies.author: kokosing

timeline.bodyText: do we really need more than one description supplier at the same time?
timeline.author: sopel39

timeline.bodyText: why this one is needed? Do we lack some extensions?
timeline.author: sopel39
sopel39

timeline.bodyText: or you could use optional binding
timeline.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText: I cannot, there has to be binding for KafkaConsumerFactory. Otherwise kafka won't fly.
replies.author: kokosing

replies.bodyText: You could use default binding which can be overridden in extension
replies.author: sopel39

timeline.message:
Do not close parameter testingKafka

testingKafka is passed as parameter and it managed and closed else where
(in tests).

Do not set kafka.table-names in tests

Kafka in tests is using tables that are injected via KafkaPlugin
constructor and so kafka.tables-names are not used anyway, because
KafkaTableDescriptionSupplier is not used in tests.
Do not close not created testing Kafka

Extract temporaryDirectory

This method is extracted so extensions could use it.

Extract temporaryDirectory

This method is extracted so extensions could use it.
